intro: Angostura trombetensis, commonly known as the Tumbez angostura, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. This species is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests.
